metadata.name: Project
metadata.description:
Project

Represents the project that storage buckets and files belong to. All data in Google Cloud Storage belongs inside a project. A project consists of a set of users, a set of APIs, billing, authentication, and monitoring settings for those APIs.

Gcloud::Storage::Project is the main object for interacting with Google Storage. {Gcloud::Storage::Bucket} objects are created, read, updated, and deleted by Gcloud::Storage::Project.

See {Gcloud#storage}

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-todo-project",
                    "/path/to/keyfile.json"
storage = gcloud.storage

storage.project #=> "my-todo-project"

metadata.name: buckets
metadata.description: Retrieves a list of buckets for the given project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

buckets = storage.buckets
buckets.each do |bucket|
  puts bucket.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all buckets with names that begin with a given prefix:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

user_buckets = storage.buckets prefix: "user-"

examples.caption: With pagination: (See {Bucket::List#token})
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

all_buckets = []
tmp_buckets = storage.buckets
while tmp_buckets.any? do
  tmp_buckets.each do |bucket|
    all_buckets << bucket
  end
  # break loop if no more buckets available
  break if tmp_buckets.token.nil?
  # get the next group of buckets
  tmp_buckets = storage.buckets token: tmp_buckets.token
end

params.name: prefix
params.description:
Filter results to buckets whose names begin with
this prefix.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of buckets to return.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
puts bucket.name

returns.description:
Returns nil if bucket does not
exist

metadata.name: create_bucket
metadata.description:
Creates a new bucket with optional attributes. Also accepts a block for defining the CORS configuration for a static website served from the bucket. See {Bucket::Cors} for details.

The API call to create the bucket may be retried under certain conditions. See {Gcloud::Backoff} to control this behavior, or specify the wanted behavior in the call with the :retries: option.

You can pass website settings for the bucket, including a block that defines CORS rule. See {Bucket::Cors} for details.

resources.title:
How to
Host a Static Website

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.create_bucket "my-bucket"

examples.caption: Specify the number of retries to attempt:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.create_bucket "my-bucket", retries: 5

examples.caption: Add CORS rules in a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

options = {
  website_main: "index.html"
  website_404: "not_found.html"
}
bucket = storage.create_bucket "my-bucket", options do |c|
  c.add_rule ["http://example.org", "https://example.org"],
             "*",
             response_headers: ["X-My-Custom-Header"],
             max_age: 300
end

params.name: acl
params.description:
Apply a predefined set of access controls to this bucket.

Acceptable values are: * auth, auth_read, authenticated, authenticated_read, authenticatedRead - Project team owners get OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access. * private - Project team owners get OWNER access. * project_private, projectPrivate - Project team members get access according to their roles. * public, public_read, publicRead - Project team owners get OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access. * public_write, publicReadWrite - Project team owners get OWNER access, and allUsers get WRITER access.

params.name: default_acl
params.description:
Apply a predefined set of default object access controls to this bucket.

Acceptable values are: * auth, auth_read, authenticated, authenticated_read, authenticatedRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access. * owner_full, bucketOwnerFullControl - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access. * owner_read, bucketOwnerRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access. * private - File owner gets OWNER access. * project_private, projectPrivate - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles. * public, public_read, publicRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: cors
params.description: The CORS rules for the bucket. Accepts an array of hashes containing the attributes specified for the resource description of cors.

params.name: location
params.description: The location of the bucket. Object data for objects in the bucket resides in physical storage within this region. Possible values include ASIA, EU, and US. (See the developer’s guide for the authoritative list. The default value is US.

params.name: logging_bucket
params.description: The destination bucket for the bucket’s logs. For more information, see Access Logs.

params.name: logging_prefix
params.description: The prefix used to create log object names for the bucket. It can be at most 900 characters and must be a valid object name . By default, the object prefix is the name of the bucket for which the logs are enabled. For more information, see Access Logs.

params.name: retries
params.description:
The number of times the API call should be
retried. Default is {Gcloud::Backoff.retries}.

params.name: storage_class
params.description: Defines how objects in the bucket are stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Values include :standard, :nearline, and :dra (Durable Reduced Availability), as well as the strings returned by Bucket#storage_class. For more information, see Storage Classes. The default value is :standard.

params.name: versioning
params.description: Whether Object Versioning is to be enabled for the bucket. The default value is false.

params.name: website_main
params.description: The index page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests the top level directory. For more information, see How to Host a Static Website .

params.name: website_404
params.description: The page returned from a static website served from the bucket when a site visitor requests a resource that does not exist. For more information, see How to Host a Static Website .

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for setting CORS rules
